meanings.definition: To make a problem or situation worse or more serious.
meanings.sent1: His constant complaints only aggravated the situation further.
meanings.sent2: The loud noise aggravated her headache.
meanings.sent3: The stubborn computer seemed to be aggravated by his attempts to fix it.
meanings.sent4: The delay in the project aggravated the already tight deadline.
meanings.sent5: Her careless mistake aggravated the already tense atmosphere in the office.

meanings.definition: To annoy or irritate someone greatly.
meanings.sent1: The persistent buzzing of the fly aggravated him during the meeting.
meanings.sent2: Her constant nagging aggravated her husband.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy aggravated the older dog with its playful antics.
meanings.sent4: The repetitive sound of the dripping faucet aggravated her to no end.
meanings.sent5: The teasing remarks from her classmates aggravated her sensitive feelings.

meanings.sent1: The aggravated tone in his voice indicated his frustration.
meanings.sent2: Her aggravated expression showed her displeasure.
meanings.sent3: The aggravated storm clouds signaled an impending downpour.
meanings.sent4: The aggravated symptoms of the illness required immediate attention.
meanings.sent5: The aggravated look on his face warned others to stay away.
